_header: At Tweeds mouth there stands a noble town
_description: ‘The Freiris of Berwick’, sometimes ascribed to William Dunbar — 589 lines in couplets (with introductory couplet: ‘As it befell and happinit into deid &c.’)

CamMagPep2553.First Lines:
As it befell and hapnit vpon deidVpon ane rever the quhilk is
                    callit tweidAt tweidis mouth þair standis ane nobill
                    toun…
CamMagPep2553.Last Lines:
…And thus my taill I end heir of the freyrChryst send ws peice
                    and lat ws nevir haue weyr

Banna.First Lines:
As It befell and happinnit in to deidVpoun a rever The quhilk is
                    callit tweid…
Banna.Last Lines:
…This is the story that hapnit of that freirNo moir thair is
                    bot Chryst ws help most deir
Banna.Attributed Title: Heir Begynnis the freiris of berwik (f. 348v)
